intro: Euphrasia paschalis, commonly known as Paschal eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes several parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, typically from April to June. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Euphrasia paschalis is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
